event.desc: baptized at St Bartholomew's Church Armley 18 March, 1731 (7 March, 1730 OS). baptized in Church of England
interred at Ockbrook by John Ockershausen

person.note: (P/G/O)+^WILSON, Elizabeth (Betty) (1731-1765) b 22.02.1730 (OS) / 05.03.1731 (NS) Wortley Parish of Leeds occupation: stockiner reception: baptized St Bartholomew’s Church Armley 07.03.1730 (OS) / 18.03.1731 (NS), received Presbyterian Church, received society Holbeck 1752, received congregation Pudsey in Fulneck 27.04.1757, sisters’ house Gomersal January 1758, sisters’ house Ockbrook 10.04.1760, sacrament Ockbrook 16.04.1760 church office: received as acoluth July family: daughter of Thomas Wilson (b 1700) and Hannah (née Renner) (b 1701), sister of Benjamin (b 1727), Hannah (Horsfield) (b 1733), Esther (Klosé) (b 1736), Grace (b 1738) and Mary d 30.11.1765 aged 34 Ockbrook, interred Ockbrook by Br J Ockershausen 02.12.1765 1st section, 4th row, 14th grave on the left from 1st path

person.note: ANDERSON, Anna Rosina (1727-1803) b 09.08.1727 Berthelsdorf reception: baptised Lutheran Church, orphan house Marienborn c 1738, sisters’ house Marienborn 1739, received congregation Marienborn 1740, sacrament Herrnhaag 1741 congregation office: children and great girls bandkeeper 1742 Marienborn church orders: received as acoluth Herrnhaag 23.06.1743 blessed as deaconess Herrnhaag 04.07.1747 church service: assistant children’s oeconomy Marienborn 1743, Herrnhaag 1743, single sisters’ labourer Bethlehem, arrived 20.09.1748, returned Europe May 1764, arrived London 24.06.1764, arrived Marienborn 04.07.1764, arrived Herrnhut August 1764, single sisters’ labourer Fulneck 1765, Bedford 1765, Fulneck 1772-1801 d 20.02.1803 aged 75 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br S T Benade 24.02.1803 grave 1136 - 2nd section, 52nd row, 2nd grave from path

event.desc: received into society/sisters’ house at Cleckheaton
received into sisters' house at Tyersal
received into congregation at Fulneck 5 April, 1751 (25 March, 1751 OS)
received into new sisters' house at Fulneck
Father died and lived with mother and Betty Midgley
Her mother remarried and she moved in with her aunt
received from Great Girls to the Single Sisters Choir
carried about a very sickly and weakly Tabernacle
interred at Fulneck by George Traneker

person.note: (P/F/G)CENNICK Sarah (Sally) (1712-1770) b 12.06.1712 (OS) / 23.06.1712 (NS) Reading resided: London 1729, returned Reading 1733, Kingswood 1741, East Tytherton 1744-1747 reception: baptized Church of England, received society Fetter Lane May 1739, left London for Germany 16.01.1746 (OS) / 27.01.1747 (NS), sisters’ house Herrnhaag 1747, received congregation Herrnhaag 1747, confirmed Herrnhaag 1747, sacrament Herrnhaag January 1748, sisters’ house Pudsey May 1748, Disciple’s House London July 1750-1751, Annenhof Holland January 1759, Herrnhut 12.08.1759, returned England 13.10.1760 congregation office: intercessor Herrnhaag 1748, congregation servant Yorkshire 1748 church orders: received as acoluth and blessed as deaconess Annenhof Holland 24.05.1759 church service: single sisters’ choir servant and choir helper Yorkshire 1748 - July 1750, single sisters’ labourer Dublin 1751, single sisters’ labourer North of Ireland 1752-1759, single sisters’ labour Bedford 13.10.1760, Lampeter c 1762, assistant labourer among single sisters and great girls of country congregations based Gomersal 16.01.1765 retired sisters’ house Fulneck 20.11.1769 family: daughter of George Cennick and Anna, sister of John (b 1718) and Anna (Stone), sister-in-law of Jane (née Bryant, later Moore) (b 1721) and ? Stone, aunt of John Cennick Stone (b 1743), and Sarah (b 1749), Ann Grove Cennick (b 1751) and Elizabeth Hannah (Swertner) (b 1752) d 24.01.1770 aged 57 sisters’ house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br J Charlesworth 29.01.1770 grave 390 - 1st section, 16th row, 4th grave from path resited gravestone - right hand side of path to terrace, 4th stone from gate

person.note: (P/G/W/F/LW)CBsbo/x+^GRAY, Timothy (1718-1795) b 30.07.1718 Northowram Parish of Halifax occupation: clothier reception: baptized Presbyterian Church, received society Birkenshaw 1743, transferred society Mirfield 1748, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 01.10.1748 (OS) / 12.10.1748 (NS), confirmed Yorkshire in Fulneck 11.02.1748 (OS) / 22.02.1749 (NS), sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 24.03.1748 (OS) / 04.04.1749 (NS), brethren’s house Fulneck 1752, advised to leave brethren’s house 03.05.1753, excluded congregation on marriage 1755, readmitted society Wyke, readmitted congregation Lower Wyke in Fulneck 13.11.1757, readmitted sacrament Lower Wyke in Fulneck 03.09.1758 m Elizabeth Ubank (b 1720) St Peter’s Church Hartshead 06.02.1755 - widowed 24.04.1789 family: son-in-law of Jeremy Ubank, brother-in-law of Sarah Ubank (b 1718), father of Timothy (b 1756), Mary (b 1757) and Martha (Ellis) (b 1760), father-in-law of William Ellis (b 1751), grandfather of Mary (b 1790), William (b 1791), Thomas (b 1793), Hannah (Rhodes) (b 1795), George (b 1797) and Joseph Ellis (b 1802), great-grandfather of William (b 1820), Eliza Ann (b 1822), Mary (Mumford) (b 1825), John Bowen (b 1827), Martha Walker (b 1831), Esther (b 1832) and Thomas Ellis (b 1834), great-great-grandfather of William Ellis Mumford (b 1851), and John (b 1865) and Frederick Ellis (b 1868), great-great-great-grandfather of Mary Russell Mumford (b 1882) d 11.08.1795 aged 76 Wyke, interred Gomersal by Br S F Church 14.08.1795 grave 40 - brethren’s section, 2nd row, 9th grave from path
There is no entry in the Yorkshire Families Document

person.note: (LW)CB>=#TAYLOR, Crispin (1698-1752) b 26.04.1698 Wyke Parish of Birstall occupation: shoemaker reception: baptized Church of England, Ingham’s society Wyke, received society Norwood Green 1742, transferred society Scholes 1748, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 01.10.1748 (OS) / 12.10.1748 (NS), confirmed Yorkshire in Fulneck 31.01.1748 (OS) / 11.02.1749 (NS), sacrament Yorkshire 24.03.1748 (OS) / 04.04.1749 (NS) m Mary Wilkinson (b 1699) St Peter’s Church Birstall 15.04.1723 (OS) / 26.04.1723 (NS) family: father of John (b 1724), Thomas (b 1732), Crispianus (b 1737), Crispin (b 1737) and Hannah (b 1740) d 16.12.1752 aged 54 of a consumption Wyke, interred Fulneck by Br W Horne 19.12.1752 grave 40 - 2nd section, 1st row, 1st grave by path

(LW/F)MORGAN, John (1743-1761) b 26.05.1743 Kensington London educated: boys’ school Marystone Buttermere Wiltshire 22.02.1748, boys’ school Smith House Lightcliffe 16.10.1749 (OS) / 27.10.1749 (NS), boys’ school Fulneck 03.05.1753 - 21.08.1758 occupation: shoemaker reception: baptized Church of England, brethren’s house Fulneck 21.08.1758 family: son of John Morgan (b 1716) and Ann (b 1717), brother of Mary (Prior) (b 1749), Hannah (b 1753), Christian Thomas (b 1758) and Frederic (b 1760) d 09.05.1761 aged 17 brethren’s house Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br A Taylor 12.05.1761 grave 189 - 2nd section, 4th row, 3rd grave from path

(LW/F)BELL, Christian (1742-1772) b 26.11.1742 (OS) / 07.12.1742 (NS) Little Wild Street London educated: boys’ school Marystone Buttermere Wiltshire 26.11.1745 (OS) / 07.12.1745 (NS), boys’ school Smith House Lightcliffe 16.10.1749 (OS) / 27.10.1749 (NS), boys’ school Fulneck 03.05.1753 - 21.08.1758 occupation: worked with Br James Charlesworth 21.08.1758, merchant reception: baptized by Br J Gambold London 20.12.1742 (OS) / 31.12.1742 (NS), received congregation Fulneck 16.04.1759, brethren’s house Fulneck 29.08.1762, sacrament Fulneck 27.03.1766 family: son of William Bell (b 1717) and Mary (née Field) (b 1718), brother of Mary (b 1739), William (b 1740), Mary (b 1745), Anna Johanna (b 1747), Peter (b 1749), John Frederick (b 1751), Thomas (b 1753) and Elizabeth (b 1754) d 07.02.1772 aged 29 of consumption brethren’s house Fulneck interred Fulneck by Br J F Zander 14.02.1772 grave 435 - 2nd section, 10th row, 9th grave from path

person.office: wash sister girls’ school Fulneck pre 1772
person.note: (LW/F)/x^KELLET, Ann (1745-1788) b 21.03.1745 Wibsey occupation: sewer, washing resided: Wibsey 1745-1761 reception: baptized Wibsey chapel Low Moor 14.04.1745, received society Wyke 1759, sisters’ house Fulneck 23.10.1761, received congregation Fulneck 01.06.1762, sacrament (choir communion) Fulneck 04.05.1764 church orders: received as acoluth Fulneck 27.07.1768 church service: wash sister girls’ school Fulneck pre 1772 family: daughter of John Kellet (b 1711) and Ann (née Woodhead) (b 1710), sister of James (b 1733), Mary (b 1735), Samuel (b 1738), Hannah (b 1748) and Martha (b 1751), sister-in-law of Martha (née Riley) (b 1733) and Elizabeth (née Gomersal) (b 1746), aunt of Joseph (b 1758), Mary (b 1761), Martha (b 1764) and Hannah Kellet (b 1766), and Ann (Ambler) (b 1768), James (b 1773), Matthew (b 1775), Joseph (b 1777), Samuel (b 1778), William (b 1881), David (b 1783), Joshua (b 1786), Abraham (b 1787) and Benjamin Kellet (b 1790), d 05.01.1788 aged 42 Fulneck, interred Fulneck by Br G Traneker 09.01.1788 grave 803 - 1st section, 47th row, 3rd grave from path

PEEL, Elizabeth (Betty) (1708-1774) b MORTIMER 14.04.1708 Cleckheaton Parish of Birstall resided: Spen reception: baptized St Peter’s Church Birstall 05.05.1708 (OS) / 16.05.1708 (NS), received society Little Gomersal 1748, received congregation Yorkshire in Fulneck 31.12.1750 (OS) / 11.01.1751 (NS), sacrament Yorkshire in Fulneck 02.08.1751 (OS) / 13.08.1751 (NS), founder member Gomersal congregation 17.04.1755 m John Peel (b 1716) family: daughter of James Mortimer, daughter-in-law of Jeremiah Peel and Grace, sister-in-law of Sarah (b 1714), Joseph (b 1719), Jeremiah (b 1721), Mary Peel (b 1722) and Grace (Haley) (b 1725), mother of Susanna (b 1734), James (b 1737), Joseph (b 1739), Mary (b 1740), Hannah (Wagner) (b 1745), William (b 1747), Samuel (b 1749) and John (b 1751), and mother-in-law of Grace (née Lister) (b 1740) and John George Wagner (b 1728), grandmother of Martha (b 1770), Mary (Stocks) (b 1772), Joseph (b 1775) and Alice Peel (b 1777), great-grandmother of John (b 1798), Joseph (b 1800) and William Stocks (b 1802), great-great-grandmother of Daniel (b 1825), Mary Anne (Hallewell) (b 1827), Elizabeth (Ellis) (b 1830), Sarah (Mégerand) (b 1832), William (b 1835), John (b 1837), Hannah (Hinchliffe, later Ainsworth) (b 1839), Joseph Stocks (b 1841) and Martha (Wilson) (b 1843), great-great-great-grandmother of William Edward (b 1858), Thomas (b 1860), Middleton (b 1861), Sarah Elizabeth (b 1865), Sarah Elizabeth (b 1871), William Arthur (b 1873) and Joseph Stocks (b 1875), great-great-great-great-grandmother of George Edward (b 1891), Frank Raistrick (b 1894), Fred (b 1897), George (b 1899), Lily Rebecca (b 1901), Norman (b 1903) and Albert Hinchliffe (b 1906), and Florence (b 1904) and Frank Lewis (b 1909), and Laura Hinchliffe (b 1899) d 02.11.1774 aged 66 Gomersal, interred Fulneck by Br E Miller 05.11.1776 grave 496 - 1st section, 21st row, 8th grave from path
